newsitem.title: USA: Anheuser promotion on hold - Calif. agency.
newsitem.headline: Anheuser promotion on hold - Calif. agency.

text.p: A California court has ordered a temporary halt to Anheuser-Busch Cos Inc's "Buy the Beer, Get the Gear" marketing program amid allegations the promotion violates state regulations, the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control said on Friday.

The promotion offers beer mugs, pool tables and other merchandise to consumers who drink Budweiser beer and accumulate redeemable "Bud" points. The state contends the program violates state regulations on gift-giving in connection with sales of alcoholic beverages.

"Anheuser-Busch's 'Buy the Beer, Get the Gear' program is a bold marketing effort we feel steps over the line by blatantly encouraging increased alcohol consumption to obtain premium points that are redeemable for non-alcoholic merchandise," Jay Stroh, the department's director, said in the statement.

"We believe the 'Bud Gear' program is an irresponsible and unlawful marketing scheme that encourages consumers, particularly young people, to drink as much beer as possible by the deadlines imposed in an effort to acquire merchandise," Stroh said.
A call to Anheuser-Busch's offices Friday evening was not answered.
The California agency said the temporary restraining order, issued by a Los Angeles Superior Court, is the first step needed to obtain a permanent injunction to stop the promotion.
